713414f-a.text:
130-138 West 49th Street, south side, between Sixth and Seventh Avenues. The Hotel Chesterfield is 130 West 49th Street.
About 1927.
Joseph Smith.

713407f-a.text:
West 49th Street, north side, east from, but not including Sixth Ave. These buildings will be demolished for the Rockefeller Center development.
September 28, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.

713408f-a.text:
(1)
West 49th Street, north side, east of Sixth Ave., as seen across the parking lot on the south side. The 70-story R.C.A. Building stands here to-day (1937).
October 18, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
A further view eastward.
October 18, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
)(3)
A view almost to Fifth Ave.
October 18, 1939.
P. L. Sperr.

709544f-a.text:
Sixth Ave., east side, north from, but not including West 49th to and including 50th Streets. In the foreground, appears the Sixth Ave., Elevated, with a station at 50th Street. A general view north east, is seen of mid-town Manhattan. Buildings in the foreground will be demolished, to provide a site for Rockefeller Center.(Radio City).
About 1930.
International News Photos.
Neg : 11L1-A

713409f-b.text:
(1)
49th Street, east from but not including Sixth Avenue, show the clearing on each side for Rockefeller Centre. Saks' Fifth Avenue, a large department store, is in the centre.
September 7, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same.
June 28, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.

709543f-b.text:
(1)  Sixth Ave., between West 49th to 51st Streets. This view shows the rears of buildings under demolition for Radio City.
June 14, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same area, as seen from the Ampico Tower Building (584 Fifth Ave)., and showing several buildings still left. The station of the Sixth Ave. Elevated Line, is at West 50th Street.
July 11. 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
A view of the 50th to 51st Street block, as seen across excavation work slightly later.
December 2, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.

709545f-a.text:
Sixth Avenue, from West 49th (left of No. 1), across 50th and 51st, to 52nd (right of No.3) Streets, showing buildings on the west side, as photographed from the Rockefeller Center clearance. The vantage point in No. 1 is given as being near 49th Street; No. 2 is obviously at 50th Street and No. 3 is from the same point. The "E1" stat n is the 50th Sreet, of the Sixth Avenue Elevated Line.
View 1 and 3 June 28, 1931
View 2 July 11, 1931
P. L. Sperr

870 Sixth Ave., at the N.E. corner of West 49th Street. Also shown is a general view northeastward of the future Rockefeller Center.
September 7, 1931.
. L. Sperr.
Na w~ 121 -A
(2)
The same; showing only the upper part of building.

709551f-a.text:
Sixth Avenue, east side, at W. 49th Street, as viewed from the rear. The photographer's vantage point is W. 50th Street; direction being southwestward. The cleared area in the foreground (50th - 49th Stis.) will be the site of the 70 storied R. C. A. Building. On the block below, the Center Theatre will be erected. Several years later (1940) the adjoining U. S. Rubber Co. Building will rise at the left far corner. Above this block front towers the clock tower atop the Paramount Building at Times Square.
View 2 is limited to the R. C. A. Building site. Note 6th Avenue appearing thru the remainiug buildings. The "E1" line there upon will be removed in 1938-9. The Hotel Maryland on 49th Street slightly west of the Ave.
June 28, 1931
Views 1,2
P. L. Sperr

709551f-b.text:
Sixth Avenue, east side, at W. 49th Street, as viewed from the rear. The photographer's vantage point is W. 50th Street; direction being southwestward. The cleared area in the foreground (50th - 49th Stis.) will be the site of the 70 storied R. C. A. Building. On the block below, the Center Theatre will be erected. Several years later (1940) the adjoining U. S. Rubber Co. Building will rise at the left far corner. Above this block front towers the clock tower atop the Paramount Building at Times Square.
View 2 is limited to the R. C. A. Building site. Note 6th Avenue appearing thru the remainiug buildings. The "E1" line there upon will be removed in 1938-9. The Hotel Maryland on 49th Street slightly west of the Ave.
June 28, 1931
Views 1,2
P. L. Sperr

709553f-b.text:
(1)
Sixth Ave., east side, between West 49th (right) and 50th (left) Streets. This block, mostly brownstone, which contained numerous and well known speakeasies, has just been razed. In the center, on the east side of Fifth Ave., is Sak's Fifth Ave. Dept Store. In the background, the tower of the new No. 444 Madison Ave. Building, the General Electric
Building and the twin spires of St. Patrick's Cathedral.
July 23, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, and also showing prominently West 49th Street.
July 23, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.

709554f-a.text:
Sixth Avenue, (foreground, not seen) east side, from W. 49th (right) to 50th (left) Streets, showing an entire block that extends to Fifth Avenue being prepared for the future Rockefeller Center Buildings. The photographer is viewing eastward from the Sixth Avenue elevated station at 50th Street and shows a general view of this midtown area. Prominent units seen are: St. Patrick's Cathedral; the G.E. Building; 444 Madison Avenue; the Goelet Puilding; tne Collegiate Church of St. Nicholas and the Grand Central Building.
September 14, 1931
Views 1 ard 2
P. L. Sperr

709554f-b.text:
Sixth Avenue, (foreground, not seen) east side, from W. 49th (right) to 50th (left) Streets, showing an entire block that extends to Fifth Avenue being prepared for the future Rockefeller Center Buildings. The photographer is viewing eastward from the Sixth Avenue elevated station at 50th Street and shows a general view of this midtown area. Prominent units seen are: St. Patrick's Cathedral; the G.E. Building; 444 Madison Avenue; the Goelet Puilding; tne Collegiate Church of St. Nicholas and the Grand Central Building.
September 14, 1931
Views 1 ard 2
P. L. Sperr

709555f-b.text:
(1)
Sixth Ave., east side, north from West 49th Street, and showing a portion of the Rockefeller Center clearance. Elevated Station shown, is the 50th Street Station of the Sixth Ave. Line. The lone building shown at the S.E. corner of West 50th Street, is No. 1258 (old No. is 386). Buildings across the clearance, are Nos. 65-27 West 51st Street,
at, adjoining and east of the N.E. corner of Sixth Ave.
September 17, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
A portion of the same view and showing prominently No. 1258.
September '7, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.

713406f-a.text:
(1)
West 49th Street, north side, west from Rockefeller Plaza to Sixth Ave. Also shown is Rockefeller Plaza, north to 50th Street. Skyscraper shown, is the new R.C.A. Building.
May 15, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
A view of the upper stories.
May 15, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.

713406f-b.text:
(1)
West 49th Street, north side, west from Rockefeller Plaza to Sixth Ave. Also shown is Rockefeller Plaza, north to 50th Street. Skyscraper shown, is the new R.C.A. Building.

(2)

713412f-a.text:
49th Street, s.s., east from but not including Sixth Avenue. These buildings have been raised and it is now the site of Radio City.
March 22, 1934.
P. L. Sperr, photographer

713405f-a.text:
West 49th Street, north side, between Rockefeller Plaza (right) and Sixth Ave. (left) showing mainly the south side of the R.C.A. Building.
1936.
Gift of Dr. Michael Wishengrad. A.R.P.S.

709549f-b.text:
Sixth Avenue, north from West 49th Street, showing the Sixth Avenue "El" and its 50th Street station at Rockefeller
(Radio) City.
The R.C. A. Building occupies the 49th to 50th Street frontage, while the R.K.O. Building is above, on the 50th to 5lst block. Note the southbound train stopping for passengers. This is one of the last trips, as shortly the line is to be discontinued and the structure razed.
View No. 2 is eastward on 50th Street and shows the wooden sides of this station silhouetted against the 70 story R.C.A. Building.
March 1939
Views 1-2
Wm. Herries

709549f-a.text:

View No. 2 is eastward on 50th Street and shows the wooden sides of this station silhouetted against the 70 story R.C.A. Building.
March 1939
Views 1-2
Wm. Herries

19th Street, north side, west from but not including Sixth Avenue.
September 9, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.

709552f-b.text:
Sixth Ave., east side, between West 49th (right) and 50th (left) Streets, and showing clearance for the new R.C.A. Building; a unit of the Rockefeller Center development, east to Fifth Ave., at which point appears Sak's Dept. Store. Directly across the top of the afore mentioned building appears No. 444 Madison Ave. On the left of same, is the
General Electric Building.
June 28, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
The same; and also showing the spires of St. Patrick's Cathedral.
June 28, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
The same, and showing excavation in progress.
February 14, 1932.
